bibl.title: Letter from A.V. McClain to Philip Showalter Hench, November 21, 1940

div1.p: McClain requests to borrow the film that Hench had made for the Washington and Jefferson College event.

div1.head: Letter from A.V. McClain to Philip Showalter Hench, November 21, 1940
div1.opener:
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
November 21, 1940
ASSISTANT TO THE PRESIDENT
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I am putting together a film of the
development of the South Campus from the time we
started to tear buildings down up to the present.

The local photographer took some movies
for us at Founders' Day and he told me this morn-
ing that he took some for you of the exercises
inside the gymnasium. I would like very much to
use these pictures. I wonder if you would be
willing to lend these to me long enough to have a
copy made. This would probably take about two
weeks and I will return the film to you promptly.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, A. V. McClain Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
